dimwishlist:item=2290416&perks=1482024992,2969185026,2416023159,2652708987
dimwishlist:item=2290416&perks=3250034553,2969185026,2416023159,2652708987

// Jorum's Claw (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, Encore, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Jorum's Claw, like other adaptive pulse rifles, has an abysmal TTK of 0.93s out of the box, with 6 crits and 1 body shot, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 4b), but is very sensitive to even the smallest of damage buffs - Radiant, for example, drops the TTK down to 0.6s (6c). The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, with the low Zoom of 17 being useful for closer-range engagements at the cost of limiting the range and damage drop-off. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot tidies up the Recoil Direction, and adds a useful bump to Handling too, and Ricochet Rounds rounds out Range and Stability. For kill-chaining, Encore as the first trait column support perk provides more stability, handling and accuracy after a kill, to make hitting your crits easier, and Golden Tricorn as the second column signature perk drops the TTK to 0.6s (5c, 1b) at one stack. It's not impossible to proc the second stack, with this being a solar weapon, which drops the TTK further to 0.53s (3c, 2b). Titans can build even further into a kill-chaining roll with Path of Burning Steps, as the damage stacks with Golden Tricorn. Recommended MW: Range, Stability of Handling depending on preference, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillClip, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=62937067&perks=839105230,1885400500,1195158366,2610012052

// Jorum's Claw (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Ricochet Rounds, Outlaw, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 292 with @illPhysics and @Legoleflash (https://open.spotify.com/episode/58kKJos3G7nO4MmMS0ScpA). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Jorum's Claw, like other adaptive pulse rifles, has an abysmal TTK of 0.93s out of the box, with 6 crits and 1 body shot, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 1.00s (4c, 4b), but is very sensitive to even the smallest of damage buffs - Radiant, for example, drops the TTK down to 0.6s (6c). The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, with the low Zoom of 17 being useful for closer-range engagements at the cost of limiting the range and damage drop-off. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot tidies up the Recoil Direction, and adds a useful bump to Handling too, and Ricochet Rounds rounds out Range and Stability. For kill-chaining, the old and trusted combination of Outlaw and Kill Clip as support and signature perks in the first and second trait columns drops the TTK to 0.6s (4c, 2b) - Radiant or Burning Steps x1 procced at the same time drops it still further to 0.53s (4c, 1b) as the damage stacks. Recommended MW: Range, Stability of Handling depending on preference, with a Targeting Adjuster mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillCHain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=62937067&perks=839105230,1885400500,1168162263,1015611457

@title:Ep 295: Season 20 Neomuna weapons
@description:Season of Defiance Neomuna weapons with Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds work well. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column and Opening Shot as the signature perk in the second will push range out to 98 (which is just shy of 40m) and add aim assist and accuracy bonuses with your first shot with both perks procced, and still keep 78 range (36.6m) and a smaller bump to accuracy for subsequent shots with Keep Away. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,47981717

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for M&KB duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds work well for M&KB. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column and Opening Shot as the signature perk in the second will push range out to 100 (which is just shy of 40m) and add aim assist and accuracy bonuses with your first shot with both perks procced, and still keep 86 range (37.7m) and a smaller bump to accuracy for subsequent shots with Keep Away. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,3619207468,47981717

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds work well. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column pushes out range to 78 (36.6m) and a bump to accuracy when procced. Finally, as your second column signature perk, Elemental Capacitor paired with an arc (+50 Handling) or void (+20 Stability) subclass round out the stats to either make it snappier or for easier follow-up shots and reduced flinch. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,3511092054

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for M&KB duelling. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. There are a range of duelling traits that help boost range and accuracy, so we can look for a little balance in the barrel and mag, rather than go all in to range - Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds work well for M&KB. For duelling, using Keep Away as the support perk in the first trait column pushes out range to 86 (37.7m) and a bump to accuracy when procced. Finally, as your second column signature perk, Elemental Capacitor paired with an arc (+50 Handling) or void (+20 Stability) subclass round out the stats to either make it snappier or for reduced flinch. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Targeting Adjustor, Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,3619207468,3511092054

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Under Pressure, Harmony
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. The fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and, with 3x Surge mods, the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. Harmony as your second trait column signature perk will both boost handling and two-tap (2c) up to 5 resilience, up to 8 with one Surge mod or any resilience with two - the damage boost will also apply to the mini-rocket. There are a few first trait column support perks that you can pair, but Under Pressure (if you're swapping between weapons you're more likely to be towards the bottom of the mag) is probably the most useful. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,1645158859,438098033

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Under Pressure, Harmony
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for M&KB kill-chaining. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mods x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will then kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a not damaging stability, to resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. Harmony as your second trait column signature perk will both boost handling and two-tap (2c) up to 5 resilience, up to 8 with one Surge mod or any resilience with two - the damage boost will also apply to the mini-rocket. There are a few first trait column support perks that you can pair, but Under Pressure (if you're swapping between weapons you're more likely to be towards the bottom of the mag) is probably the most useful. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,1645158859,438098033

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Killing Wind, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a classic kill-chaining roll, Killing Wind as your support perk in the first trait column, and Kill Clip as the signature perk in the second are a classic combination, improving gunfeel and then two-tapping up to 9 resilience when procced. Any damage boost on top (such as Radiant, of a Surge mod) will two-tap any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2450788523,1015611457

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Killing Wind, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining on M&BK. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a not damaging stability, to resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a classic kill-chaining roll, Killing Wind as your support perk in the first trait column, and Kill Clip as the signature perk in the second are a classic combination, improving gunfeel and then two-tapping up to 9 resilience when procced. Any damage boost on top (such as Radiant, or a Surge mod) will two-tap any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,2450788523,1015611457

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, (Keep Away, Under Pressure), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining and Strand synergy. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a little extra stability to go along with some extra range, to calm the kick and resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a kill-chaining roll that builds into the Strand toolbox, as your support perk in your first trait column, either Keep Away (adding range and accuracy at noral HC engagement distances) or Under Pressure (improving gunfeel towards the botton of the mag) have their place, together with Hatchling as the signature perk in the second column. Thread of Evolution improves Threadlings so anyone hit by one can be two-tapped at any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,831391274
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=1482024992,1885400500,1645158859,831391274

// Round Robin (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, (Keep Away, Under Pressure), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining and Strand synergy. Shapeable. The out-of-the-box 1.0s TTK, with 2 crits and 1 body shot is definitely not competitive, so the trick is always to find a way to boost damage enough to two-tap in 0.5s. The Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait can be very handy - landing hits with 45% of a magazine within 7s of each other (so, 4 shots on Round Robin at base magazine size) will launch a mini rocket, with an energy type matching the weapon, doing 29 damage (14 impact, 15 explosive) on the next shot - these will also take any active damage buff. With Surge mod x3, the fifth shot will launch the mini-rocket and the sixth shot will kill up to 9 resilience. You'll probably be better off with a not damaging stability, to resist flinch a little better (a flinch resist mod or two helps too), so start off with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds in the barrel and mag. For a kill-chaining roll that builds into the Strand toolbox, as your support perk in your first trait column, either Keep Away (adding range and accuracy at noral HC engagement distances) or Under Pressure (improving gunfeel towards the botton of the mag) have their place, together with Hatchling as the signature perk in the second column. Thread of Evolution improves Threadlings so anyone hit by one can be two-tapped at any resilience. Recommended MW: Range, Handling or Stability, with a Quick Access Sling, Targeting Adjustor or Sprint Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,3619207468,831391274
dimwishlist:item=2034215657&perks=202670084,1885400500,1645158859,831391274

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Headseeker
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range and stability up with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 80 (that's 39.46m ADS-ed) and 61 respectively, and take the Recoil Direction to 95 with a Counterbalance mod. Enhanced Keep Away as your first trait column support perk takes the Range to 90 (40.77mm ADS), and boosts accuracy and, while Headseeker as the second column signature perk doesn't reduce TTK at all, but the additional Aim Assist will make the 0.67s TTK with 5 crits and a body shot for resiliences of 8 or less easier to hit. It also means you'll two burst with one body and two crits at resiliences up to 7. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1482024992,1885400500,3619207468,460017080

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Extended Barrel, Ricochet Rounds, Keep Away, Headseeker
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range, stability and recoil direction up with Extended Barrel (even at the cost of a -10 Handling penalty) and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 83 (that's 39.85m ADS-ed), 54 and 90 respectively, and then take the Recoil Direction to 100 with a Counterbalance mod. Enhanced Keep Away as your first trait column support perk takes the Range to 93 (41.16mm ADS), and boosts accuracy and, while Headseeker as the second column signature perk doesn't reduce TTK at all, but the additional Aim Assist will make the 0.67s TTK with 5 crits and a body shot for resiliences of 8 or less easier to hit. It also means you'll two burst with one body and two crits at resiliences up to 7. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1467527085,1885400500,3619207468,460017080

// Phyllotactic Spiral (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Tunnel Vision, Kill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. Lowish stats by comparison with other High-Impacts, in particular Range and Stability, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. An out-of-the-box all-Resilience TTK of 0.67s with 6 crits is difficult to achieve, especially with only 31 Aim Assistance, without help from perks and helmet targetting mods. Push the range and stability up with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds and a Range Masterwork to 80 (that's 39.46m ADS-ed) and 61 respectively, and take the Recoil Direction to 95 with a Counterbalance mod. For kill-chaining, the classic combination of Tunnel Vision in the first trait column as your support perk and Kill Clip as your second column signature perk increases aim assist by 20 and boosts accuracy, and reduces TTK to 0.6s (4c, 1b) for reloading after a kill. You need to hit with four bursts to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait on the fifth so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3635821806&perks=1482024992,1885400500,2946784966,1015611457

// Synchronic Roulette (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Envious Assassin, Cascade Point
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Lowish stats by comparison with other precision SMGs, in particular Range, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. Precision SMGs have a 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and 2 body shots and a slowish Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.9s (5c, 5b). It should be fairly easy to control as a precision-frame SMG, so push out the range as far as you can with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds, and a range Masterwork - all of those will get you to 78 which equates to 20.57m in-game. You could make an interesting kill-chaining swap weapon with Envious Assassin in the first trait column as your support perk and then Cascade Point in the second as your signature perk. Each kill adds 3 to the mag after you swap, and reduces TTK to a speedy 0.56s (7c, 2b). Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=811403305&perks=202670084,1885400500,968510818,3751912585

// Synchronic Roulette (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Pulse Monitor, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Lowish stats by comparison with other precision SMGs, in particular Range, but that's what you'd expect from a world drop weapon. Precision SMGs have a 0.8s TTK with 6 crits and 2 body shots and a slowish Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.9s (5c, 5b). It should be fairly easy to control as a precision-frame SMG, so push out the range as far as you can with Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds, and a range Masterwork - all of those will get you to 78 which equates to 20.57m in-game. You are never going to make an Immortal out of Synchronic Roulette, but the combination of Pulse Monitor in your first trait column as your support perk and Target Lock as your second column, signature perk will mean that, while you're out of cover firing at a target with Target Lock, which cuts TTK to 0.7s (7c, 1b), if you are taking damage from return fire you'll get a refilled magazine and a +50 boost to Handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=811403305&perks=202670084,1885400500,972757866,365154968

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Kickstart
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Using Arrowhead Brake and a Counterbalance mod takes the Recoil Direction to a far more controllable 92 and bumps up Handling to 62, while a combination of Projection Fuse and a Range Masterwork pushes range out to 16.2m while ADS-ed. In the first trait column as your support perk, Under Pressure should be procced constantly which will add 30 stability to make the recoil easier to control and add accuracy to the bolts, and then as your second column signature perk, Kickstart reduces the TTK to 0.63s by applying a 0.8 scalar to charge time. Any additional damage boost (such as Radiant) will drop to TTK to 0.6s with only six bolts needed to kill at 10 Resilience. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=839105230,2969185026,1645158859,1754714824

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a void subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Using Arrowhead Brake and a Counterbalance mod takes the Recoil Direction to a far more controllable 92 and bumps up Handling to 62, while a combination of Projection Fuse and a Range Masterwork pushes range out to 16.2m while ADS-ed. In the first trait column as your support perk, Under Pressure should be procced constantly which will add 30 stability to make the recoil easier to control and add accuracy to the bolts, and then as your second column signature perk, Enhanced Elemental Capacitor with a void subclass adds a further 25 Stability to make this a bit of a laser. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=839105230,2969185026,1645158859,3511092054

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Projection Fuse, Well Rounded, Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. With enough range on a fusion rifle, you can rely more on Aim Assist than Stability - Full Bore, Projection Fuse, and a Range Masterwork will push the range out to 58, which is 17m ADS-ed, at the cost of 10 Stability and 5 Handling - just make sure you've got Targeting mods on your helmet too. In the first trait column as your support park, Well Rounded is easy to proc using Strand abilities - 1 stack recovers the Full Bore penalties and takes the range to 65 (ADS 17.52m), and at 2 stacks, you'll have 78 range (ADS 18.05m), 40 Stability and 67 Handling. The Enhanced version is even better adding 12 to Range, Stability and Handling per stack - at 2 stacks you'll push out range to 18.24m, which is more than Cartesian! Demolitionist as your second column signature perk, completes the loop by generating 20% grenade ability energy on a kill (22% for the Enhanced perk). You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=202670084,2969185026,744594675,3523296417

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Extended Barrel, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Elemental Capacitor
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a Stasis subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Extended Barrel, Projection Fuse, a Range Masterwork and a Counterbalance mod will push the Range out to 53, which is 16.73m ADS-ed, and improve Recoil Direction by 25, at the cost of 10 Handling. In the support perk, first trait column, slot Under Pressure (which should be procced constantly adds 30 Stability and accuracy, and then in the second for your signature perk, Elemental Capacitor used with Stasis, takes the Recoil Direction to a near-perfect 97, which should make for a very controllable FR. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often.Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=1467527085,2969185026,1645158859,3511092054

// Iterative Loop (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Projection Fuse, Under Pressure, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling with a Light subclass. Shapeable. Rapid Frame Fusion Rifles have a TTK of 0.77s, with 7 bolts at any resilience. Overall decent stats, but with 1 less zoom than Cartesian Coordinate but good range to compensate. Using Arrowhead Brake and a Counterbalance mod takes the Recoil Direction to a far more controllable 92 and bumps up Handling to 62, while a combination of Projection Fuse and a Range Masterwork pushes range out to 16.2m while ADS-ed. In the first trait column as your support perk, Under Pressure should be procced constantly which will add 30 stability to make the recoil easier to control and add accuracy to the bolts, and then as your second column signature perk, Adrenaline Junkie x5 from a grenade kill will drop the TTK to 0.7s with six bolts and any additional damage boost (such as solar Radiant) drops the all-resilience TTK to 0.63s with only five bolts. You need to hit with three shots to proc the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait so, unfortunately you're unlikely to see it often. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=839105230,2969185026,1645158859,11612903

// Basso Ostinato (PvP first-choice roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Accurized Rounds, Well Rounded, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Rapid-fire shotguns have the lowest range of the shotgun archetype, so Basso Ostinato needs the right perks to compete. If you're lucky enough to drop one with Corkscrew or Smallbore and Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork, that gets you to 51 (5.27m range hipfire or ADS). But then if you add on Well Rounded as your first trait column support park, and proc both stacks, and then get Opening Shot as your second column signature perk as well, that pushes range out to 97 (6.59m) - aim for the neck and you should be good for a OHK in range, or a two-hit kill out to 8m or so. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=4090651448,3142289711,744594675,47981717
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1482024992,3142289711,744594675,47981717

// Basso Ostinato (PvP backup roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Accurized Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). Backup PvP pick for duelling. Rapid-fire shotguns have the lowest range of the shotgun archetype, so Basso Ostinato needs the right perks to compete. If you're lucky enough to drop one with Corkscrew or Smallbore and Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork, that gets you to 51 (5.27m range hipfire or ADS). Perpetual Motion as your first trait column support park, is pretty easy to proc both stacks for 20 to handling, stability and reload speed, and then get Opening Shot as your second column signature perk as well, that pushes range out to 76 (6.00m) - aim for the neck and you should be good for a OHK in range, or a two-hit kill out to 7.5m or so. Recommended MW: Range, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=4090651448,3142289711,1428297954,47981717
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1482024992,3142289711,1428297954,47981717

// Volta Bracket (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Alloy Mag, Fluted Barrel), Firmly Planted, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Average stats by comparison with other Aggressive sniper rifles and a tough-to-use 50 Zoom. But this can be very usable with the right perks. We can get range elsewhere, so you can use the barrel to boost handling with Fluted Barrel and a Handling Masterwork, and use the magazine to (unusually) boost reload speed as the most useful remaining stat - Alloy Mag is better with an empty mag or Flared Magwell if you still have one in the chamber. The combination of Enhanced Firmly Planted adding 35 Handling, 25 Stability, boosting recoil control, and improving accuracy and Enhanced Opening Shot as the second column signature perk layering on another 30 Range, 25 Aim Assist and more accuracy, brings you to totals of 100 Range, 53 Stability, 84 Handling and 68 Aim Assist. After landing two hits, the Nanotech Tracer Rocket origin trait should proc on the third shot (if you've picked up an ammo brick) - it won't make anyone body-shottable, but it's a bit of fun. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,1431678320,280464955,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,3230963543,280464955,47981717

// Volta Bracket (PvP backup roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Alloy Mag, Fluted Barrel), Keep Away, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). Backup PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. Average stats by comparison with other Aggressive sniper rifles and a tough-to-use 50 Zoom. But this can be very usable with the right perks. We can get range elsewhere, so you can use the barrel to boost handling with Fluted Barrel and a Handling Masterwork, and use the magazine to (unusually) boost reload speed as the most useful remaining stat - Alloy Mag is better with an empty mag or Flared Magwell if you still have one in the chamber. The combination of Enhanced Keep Away in your first trait column as your support perk, boosting range by 12, Reload Speed by 24, and improving accuracy and Enhanced Opening Shot as the second column signature perk layering on another 30 Range, 25 Aim Assist and more accuracy, brings you to totals of 100 Range, 49 Handling and 68 Aim Assist. After landing two hits, the Nanotech Tracer Rocket origin trait should proc on the third shot (if you've picked up an ammo brick) - it won't make anyone body-shottable, but it's a bit of fun. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,1431678320,3619207468,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3619207468,47981717

// Volta Bracket (PvP first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Accurized Rounds, Firmly Planted, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). Backup PvP pick for kill-chaining with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Average stats by comparison with other Aggressive sniper rifles and a tough-to-use 50 Zoom. But this can be very usable with the right perks. Fluted Barrel is the traditional barrel choice to bump handling, and Accurized Rounds does the same to range. In the first trat column as the support perk, Enhanced Firmly Planted adds 35 Handling, 25 Stability, boosts recoil control, and improves accuracy to make follow up shots easier. Hatchling as the second column signature perk spawns a Threadling on a crit kill - any opponent damaged by it up to 9 resilience can be body shot - if you run Thread of Evolution you'll be able to body shot any resilience. After landing two hits, the Nanotech Tracer Rocket origin trait should proc on the third shot (if you've picked up an ammo brick) - it won't make anyone body-shottable on its own, but it's a bit of fun. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3920310144&perks=1840239774,3142289711,280464955,831391274

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid (PvP first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, (Shot Swap, Unrelenting), One For All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The first-ever Compressed Wave Frame power grenade launcher, so we have no real comparisons to make. Unfortunately it's not a great choice for PvP. To get a one-hit-kill you have to get a direct impact hit and the wave to strike too. If you do craft one for PvP, the blast radius stat has no real effect, so go all in to Velocity - Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds with a Velocity Masterwork push the stat to 63. There's thin pickings for your first trait column support perk - Shot Swap means at least means you have a fast stow speed after you're finished or, possibly, Unrelenting. Again, there's not much on offer in the second trait column for your signature perk - One For All when procced does mean that you can one-hit-kill with the wave alone, so maybe this is one to save for using on a control zone in 6s. You might occasionally see the Nanotech Tracer Rockets origin trait proc, but that'll more be for fun than anything else. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2586829431,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3108830275,4049631843

// Circular Logic (PvP first-choice roll)
// Smallbore, Extended Mag, Keep Away, Eye of the Storm
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. It's an adaptive frame LMG, so it's not the best choice for any Crucible activities. There's a base 0.53s TTK with 5 crits and 0 body shots and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.67s (2c, 4b). With that said, Smallbore adds a bit of extra range and stability, and then you want to get you mag as large as possible to pick up as many shots from a power ammo brick as you can. You're not going to be reloading, so Extended Mag and a Backup Mag are the way to go. For duelling, Keep Away in the first trait column as your support perk adds in some 10 range and accuracy when you're not in CQC. Eye of the Storm in the second as your signature perk layers on additional handling and accuracy while you're in a gunfight. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,3619207468,699525795

// Circular Logic (PvP first-choice roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 295 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5R8QyPNo18IjGX4iukcE3k). First-choice PvP pick for hip-fire kill-chaining. It's an adaptive frame LMG, so it's not the best choice for any Crucible activities. There's a base 0.53s TTK with 5 crits and 0 body shots and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.67s (2c, 4b). With that said, Smallbore adds a bit of extra range and stability, and then you want to get you mag as large as possible to pick up as many shots from a power ammo brick as you can. You're not going to be reloading, so Extended Mag and a Backup Mag are the way to go. If you're happy to hip-fire, for kill-chaining Offhand Strike as the first trait column support perk boosts range and accuracy after that first kill, while one stack of Golden Tricorn in the second column as your signature perk makes the TTK easier to get with 3 crits and 2 bodies, while two stacks reduces TTK to 0.4s (2c, 2b). Similarly, a Hatchling with Thread of Evolution on a Strand subclass will soften up an opponent for the same 0.4s TTK. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,2416023159,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2187717691&perks=1482024992,2420895100,2416023159,831391274

@title:Ep 295: Season 20 War Table weapons
@description:Season of Defiance Queensguard craftable weapons with Noble Deeds origin trait, and Imperial Decree

// Perpetualis (PvP first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, (Elemental Capacitor, Zen Moment), Eye of the Storm
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Perpetualis has mostly in-bands stats except for lowish stability and a lowest in subfamily recoil direction of 53, but decent Aim Assistance. A base TTK of 0.8s with 9 crits and no body shots at any resilience is reasonable, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK 0.9s (7c, 3b) is easy to achieve. Arrowhead Brake is really the only sensible choice in the barrel, to improve recoil direction, with Accurized Rounds to improve range in the magazine. For a duelling roll, Elemental Capacitor on void will sort out the stability or stasis to help recoil direction, or Zen Moment will bring the recoil under control in the first trait column as your support perk. In the second, as your signature perk, Eye of the Storm makes headshots easier to hit and boosts handling just for being in a gunfight. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=839105230,3142289711,3511092054,699525795
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=839105230,3142289711,2387244414,699525795

// Perpetualis (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Killing Wind, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining, and Strand synergy. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Perpetualis has mostly in-bands stats except for lowish stability and a lowest in subfamily recoil direction of 53, but decent Aim Assistance. A base TTK of 0.8s with 9 crits and no body shots at any resilience is reasonable, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK 0.9s (7c, 3b) is easy to achieve. Arrowhead Brake is really the only sensible choice in the barrel, to improve recoil direction, with Accurized Rounds to improve range in the magazine. For a kill-chaining roll, Killing Wind as the first trait column support perk, adds mobility, handling and accuracy perks on a kill, and makes the one stack of Golden Tricorn in the second column as your signature perk, which reduces TTK to 0.7s (7c, 1b) easier to hit. If you can proc the second stack with a Strand ability, the TTK drops to a lightning fast 0.5s (6c 0b). Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=839105230,3142289711,2450788523,2610012052

// Perpetualis (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, (Envious Assassin, Elemental Capacity), Cascade Point
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Perpetualis has mostly in-bands stats except for lowish stability and a lowest in subfamily recoil direction of 53, but decent Aim Assistance. A base TTK of 0.8s with 9 crits and no body shots at any resilience is reasonable, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK 0.9s (7c, 3b) is easy to achieve. Arrowhead Brake is really the only sensible choice in the barrel, to improve recoil direction, with Accurized Rounds to improve range in the magazine. In the first trait column as your support perk or kill chaining, a combination of Envious Assassin, to overfill the magazine or Elemental Capacitor on an Arc subclass to turbocharge handling, and Cascade Point in the second for your second column signature perk reduces the base TTK to 0.48s for 2.5s after swapping to this following a kill with another weapon. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance or Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=839105230,3142289711,968510818,3751912585

// Raconteur (PvP first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Rapid Hit, Successful Warm-Up
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Out of the box, all precision bows have a two body, no crit 1.33s TTK. Raconteur's stats are a mixed bag - the lowest Accuracy, but the highest Handling and Airborne Effectiveness. As with all bows, we're looking to reduce Draw Time with the bowstring - Elastic String has the biggest reduction, and a Draw Time Masterwork, and then recover the lost Accuracy with the Arrow - Fiberglass Arrow Shaft more than does this. We can choose both the S-Tier Enhanced Archer's Tempo in the first trait column as the support perk, and Enhanced Successful Warm-Up in the second column as the signature perk. Because they apply multipliers, you can get below the 0.54s floor for Precision bow draw times, down to an incredible 0.27s draw time, reducing your 2 body TTK to 0.95s. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Targeting Adjustor or Quick Access Sling mod or, if you're building into an aerial playstyle, an Icarus Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,3429800428,201365942,2652708987

// Raconteur (PvP first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, (Rapid Hit, Surplus), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for duelling and Stasis synergy. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Out of the box, all precision bows have a two body, no crit 1.33s TTK. Raconteur's stats are a mixed bag - the lowest Accuracy, but the highest Handling and Airborne Effectiveness. As with all bows, we're looking to reduce Draw Time with the bowstring - Elastic String has the biggest reduction, and a Draw Time Masterwork, and then recover the lost Accuracy with the Arrow - Fiberglass Arrow Shaft more than does this. Either Rapid Hit or Surplus in the first trait column as your support perk will reduce your loading/draw time - Surplus x2 is about the same as Rapid Hit, and doesn't need proccing with a headshot. As your second column, signature trait, Headstone works with the Stasis toolkit, prevents revives and can generate AoE damage if shattered. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Targeting Adjustor or Quick Access Sling mod or, if you're building into an aerial playstyle, an Icarus Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller

// Raconteur (PvP first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Shot Swap, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for duelling and Stasis synergy. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Out of the box, all precision bows have a two body, no crit 1.33s TTK. Raconteur's stats are a mixed bag - the lowest Accuracy, but the highest Handling and Airborne Effectiveness. As with all bows, we're looking to reduce Draw Time with the bowstring - Elastic String has the biggest reduction, and a Draw Time Masterwork, and then recover the lost Accuracy with the Arrow - Fiberglass Arrow Shaft more than does this. If you're playing aggessively, using Shot Swap in the first trait column as you signature perk will let you build up charges for lightning fast swaps to your energy or special weapon for CQC. As your second column, signature trait, Headstone works with the Stasis toolkit, prevents revives and can generate AoE damage if shattered. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Targeting Adjustor or Quick Access Sling mod or, if you're building into an aerial playstyle, an Icarus Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,3429800428,2586829431,124408337

// Royal Executioner (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Projection Fuse, Offhand Strike, Killing Wind
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for kill-chaining. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. Unfortunately, the stats just aren't quite as good as other adaptive fusion rifles at base - you do need 6 out of 7 bolts to kill reliably, with a TTK of 0.86s. As there's no Under Pressure or High-Impact Reserves, so lean into the meme machine build. Start off by cleaning up the Recoil Direction with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel and a Counterbalance mod, to clean up the Recoil Direction and Projection Fuse in the Battery and a Range Masterwork to push out range. In the first trait column, as your support perk, Offhand Strike pushes out hip-fire shots to a ridiculous range, and Killing Wind in the second column as your signature perk doubles down, so  you'll be able to kill with six bolts out to 30.5m from the hip after your first kill. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,2969185026,2416023159,2450788523

// Prodigal Return (PvP first-choice roll)
// Quick Launch, (Disorienting Grenades, Proximity Grenades), Envious Assassin, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and reload speed is nice. As at Season 20, tis is our first shapeable lightweight energy grenade launcher. The stats are in-band, so the usual play is to use the barrel to improve velocity - Quick Launch is the best for this. In the magazine, you have a choice - Disorienting Grenades reduce the blast radius to 0, but will still one-hit-kill on impact and will blind opponents around the detonation, or Proximity Grenades give you a bit more latitude with your aiming, but won't OHK as you'll lose impact damage. In the first trait column, as your support park, the new to Season 20 Envious Assassin will give you two in the chamber after a kill with another weapon, and in the second column as your signature perk, Disruption Break makes blinting with a kinetic primary easy, by increasing kinetic damage by 50%, so you only have to breathe on them (kinetically) for a kill. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,3032599245,968510818,1683379515
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,409831596,968510818,1683379515

// Regnant (PvP first-choice roll)
// Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Shot Swap, Destabilising Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for kill chaining. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling is nice. Regnant has more PvE than PvP perks, but if you're tempted to make your own, Linear Compensator in the Barrel and High Explosive Ordnance in the mag, with a Blast Radius Masterwork increase blast radius to 75 and velocity to 38. There's nothing really that helpful in the first trait column to use as your support perk, so Shot Swap is your Hobson's choice for a fast swap back when you're done and Destabilising Rounds at least makes for an easy clean-up for any opponents caught in the blast who are still standing. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-KillChain, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=1441682018,1380253176,2586829431,2048641572

// Caretaker (PvP first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, (Burst Guard, Heavy Guard), Energy Transfer, Valiant Charge
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for highly mobile duelling. Shapeable. The Noble Deeds origin trait is a bit difficult to feel when procced, but even a little extra handling and faster charge rate is nice. If you really insist on using a sword in your power slot, why not build into the new Valiant Charge perk in the second trait, signature perk column with Jagged Edge in the blade, Heavy Guard or Burst Guard as your guard - you'll need to guard and tank a bit of damage. As you'll being doing that, Energy Transfer as your first column support trait will mean you'll gain some extra class ability energy, and then you can close the gap to your opponent with Valiant Charge for a speedy kill. Recommended MW: Impact, with a Quick Access Sling mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,3625355092,2030760728,4274614370
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,2349202967,2030760728,4274614370

// Imperial Decree (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Choke, Accurized Rounds, Slideshot, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for aggressive duelling. Shapeable. The To Excess origin trait can work well in PvP for a grenade and melee energy regeneration boost after a kill. This is the Astral Horizon we've got at home for those who don't want to dip their toes into Trials. There's no Adept mods, but we do have Enhanced Perks instead, so it's a close contest between the two overall. As there's no option for Elemental Capacity, it is going to feel heavier, so go all into range and consistency - Full Choke in the barrel keeps the pellet spread tighter, and then the combination of Accurized Rounds and a Range Masterwork together with Slideshot in the first trait column as your support perk and Opening Shot in the second as your signature perk will get your range out to 94 which will kill at any resilience out to 7m with 10 out of 12 pellets. Recommended MW: Range, with a Freehand Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=318443586&perks=1047830412,3142289711,3161816588,47981717

// Imperial Decree (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Choke, Accurized Rounds, Threadt Detector, Opening Shot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 296 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/23ibFKKShmXHAuphKQLgXz). First-choice PvP pick for holdout weapon duelling. Shapeable. The To Excess origin trait can work well in PvP for a grenade and melee energy regeneration boost after a kill. This is the Astral Horizon we've got at home for those who don't want to dip their toes into Trials. There's no Adept mods, but we do have Enhanced Perks instead, so it's a close contest between the two overall. As there's no option for Elemental Capacitor, Imperial Decree is going to feel heavier without additional help from perks, so go all into range and consistency with barrel and mag - Full Choke keeps the pellet spread tighter, and then the combination of Accurized Rounds, a Range Masterwork and Opening Shot as the second trait column signature perk gets the range to 74 - you'll be lethal out to around 6.5m with 10 out of 12 pellets. To use as a holdout weapon, Threat Detector as the support perk in the first trait column boosts Handling to 58 with one stack or 100 with two, for snappy ready, ADS and stow speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a Freehand Grip mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=318443586&perks=1047830412,3142289711,4071163871,47981717

@title:Ep 296: Season 20 World drop and Guardian Games weapons
@description:Season of Defiance World World drop and Guardian Games weapons

// The Title (PvP first-choice roll)
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Dynamic Sway Reduction, Rangefinder
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. An out-of-the-box TTK of 0.77s with 8 crits and 2 body shots, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.83s (6c, 5b) is fairly competitive - any damage boost, such as Radiant or a Surge mod will drop those to 0.67s (9c, 0b) and 0.77s (5c, 5b) respectively. It's true that the stats don't look great, against an IKELOS, or Immortal (although that's in the kinetic slot), but exclude those two and it's in-band. To compensate, The Title has a critical extra point of Zoom and can roll Dynamic Sway Reduction in the first trait column as a support perk alongside Rangefinder as the second column signature perk, so you can definitely make this competitive with the right perks. You'll need to push out your range as much as possible - Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds with a Range Masterwork will give you a useful range of up to 25m while ADS, and let Dynamic Sway Reduction help control the recoil and improve your accuracy. You obviously lose out on now having a damage perk, but you might find hitting those crits easier. Choose between the Classy Contender and Hakke Breach Armaments origin traits depending on how may Titan Barricades you're encountering. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,1359896290,2846385770

// The Title (PvP backup roll)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). Backup PvP pick for duelling. An out-of-the-box TTK of 0.77s with 8 crits and 2 body shots, and an Accuracy-Adjusted TTK of 0.83s (6c, 5b) is fairly competitive - any damage boost, such as Radiant or a Surge mod will drop those to 0.67s (9c, 0b) and 0.77s (5c, 5b) respectively. It's true that the stats don't look great, against an IKELOS, or Immortal (although that's in the kinetic slot), but exclude those two and it's in-band. To compensate, The Title has a critical extra point of Zoom and can roll Dynamic Sway Reduction in the first trait column as a support perk alongside Rangefinder as the second column signature perk, so you can definitely make this competitive with the right perks. You'll need to push out your range as much as possible with your barrel and mag which, together with a Range Masterwork, will give you a useful range of up to 25-26m while ADS, and let Dynamic Sway Reduction help control the recoil and improve your accuracy. You obviously lose out on now having a damage perk, but you might find hitting those crits easier. Choose between the Classy Contender and Hakke Breach Armaments origin traits depending on how may Titan Barricades you're encountering. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1467527085,1885400500,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=3250034553,1885400500,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1482024992,1885400500,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=4090651448,1885400500,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1968497646,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1467527085,1968497646,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=3250034553,1968497646,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1482024992,1968497646,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1561002382,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1467527085,1561002382,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=3250034553,1561002382,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1482024992,1561002382,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=4090651448,1561002382,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,679225683,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1467527085,679225683,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=3250034553,679225683,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=1482024992,679225683,1359896290,2846385770
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=4090651448,679225683,1359896290,2846385770

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Steady Rounds, Moving Target, (Keep Away, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. Stability helps with hitting crits consistently as well, so Steady Rounds will work fine in the magazine - recover the lost range if you can with a Range Masterwork. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. Moving Target as the support perk in the first trait column takes Aim Assist up to 85, and with three Targeting mods that can be pushed to 95 so you can hit those crits. The extra ADS strafe speed builds into the lightweight mobility bonus as well. In the second column as a signature perk, Keep Away adds range and accuracy when procced or Explosive Payload adds physical and visual flinch. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3177308360,588594999,3619207468
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3177308360,588594999,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Moving Target, (Keep Away, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. If you've got a Stability Masterwork to help keep shots on target, then Accurized Rounds is fine in the mag slot. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. Moving Target as the support perk in the first trait column takes Aim Assist up to 85, and with three Targeting mods that can be pushed to 95 so you can hit those crits. The extra ADS strafe speed builds into the lightweight mobility bonus as well. In the second column as a signature perk, Keep Away adds range and accuracy when procced or Explosive Payload adds physical and visual flinch. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3142289711,588594999,3619207468
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3142289711,588594999,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Steady Rounds, Gutshot Straight, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. Stability helps with hitting crits consistently as well, so Steady Rounds will work fine in the magazine - recover the lost range if you can with a Range Masterwork. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. Gutshot Straight in the first trait column as your support perk has an interesting side-effect in boosting the explosive damage from Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk - enough to reduce the crits needed for the 0.9s TTK (3c, 1b), to make it sightly easier to achieve, but you might want to throw some Targeting mods on your helmet to help with headshots. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3177308360,1365187766,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Gutshot Straight, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. If you've got a Stability Masterwork to help keep shots on target, then Accurized Rounds is fine in the mag slot. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. Gutshot Straight in the first trait column as your support perk has an interesting side-effect in boosting the explosive damage from Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk - enough to reduce the crits needed for the 0.9s TTK (3c, 1b), to make it sightly easier to achieve, but you might want to throw some Targeting mods on your helmet to help with headshots. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3142289711,1365187766,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Steady Rounds, Zen Moment, (Keep Away, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. Stability helps with hitting crits consistently as well, so Steady Rounds will work fine in the magazine - recover the lost range if you can with a Range Masterwork. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. In the first trait column as your support perk, Zen Moment is a great consistency perk to help you hitting crits - take your choice from Keep Away to add range and accuracy, or Explosive Payload for physical and visual flinch. Recommended MW: Range, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod. You might want to throw some Targeting mods on your helmet to help with headshots too. Tags: PvP, PvP-Duel, PvP-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3177308360,2387244414,3619207468
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3177308360,2387244414,3038247973

// Taraxippos (PvP first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Zen Moment, (Keep Away, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast 297 with @Legoleflash and @illPhysics (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6QQITPbKjlJSRu73uucQ38). First-choice PvP pick for duelling. Who would've thought that a lightweight scout rifle would be the hotness of the Season 20 Guardian Games? The stats are decent and while the out-of-the-box TTK of 0.9s with 4 crits and 0 body shots or Accuracy Adjusted TTK of 1.2s (2c, 3b) aren't really competitive, Taraxippos can still fit into an aggressive playstyle, using the +30 Mobility from the Lightweight frame. The first thing you need to do is clean up the Recoil Direction - Arrowhead Brake is the best of the barrel perks, taking it up to 84. If you've got a Stability Masterwork to help keep shots on target, then Accurized Rounds is fine in the mag slot. The Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait helps with a chunky +20 stability in the top half of the mag too. In the first trait column as your support perk, Zen Moment is a great consistency perk to help you hitting crits - take your choice from Keep Away to add range and accuracy, or Explosive Payload for physical and visual flinch. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Counterbalance mod or, if you're able to handle the recoil direction without, a Targeting Adjustor mod.
